metadata.title: CVE-2017-16995 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
The check_alu_op function in kernel/bpf/verifier.c in the Linux kernelthrough 4.4 allows local users to cause a denial of service (memorycorruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact by leveragingincorrect sign extension.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16995` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-119-generic - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-4.4.0-119-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-4.4.0-119-lowlatency - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-4.4.0-119-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-4.4.0-119-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-4.4.0-119-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-4.4.0-119-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-119.143
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-119-generic - 4.4.0-119.143
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1086-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1086.94
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-32-generic - 4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1

linux-image-4.13.0-32-lowlatency - 4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-32-generic - 4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1020-kvm - 4.4.0-1020.25
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-9026-euclid - 4.4.0-9026.28
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-9026-euclid - 4.4.0-9026.28
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1015-oem - 4.13.0-1015.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-119.143').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1086.94').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1088.93').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1054.63').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1005.7').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1006.9').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1020.25').
linux-euclid package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-9026.28').
linux-oem package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1015.16').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1031.33~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1008.10').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1008.10~16.04.1').
